description.narrative: table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } The Project involves the development, financing, construction, operation and maintenance of a green field 200MWac, approximately 242MWp solar photovoltaic (PV) plant in Amman East, Jordan. The Project is being developed by Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company PJSC (Masdar) and the generated electricity will be sold to the Jordanian National Electric Power Company (NEPCO) under a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement.

mailing-address.narrative: Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company PJSC - Masdar Basel Dahleh Project Manager +971 2 653 2012 bdahleh@masdar.ae PO Box 54115, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } Nisrine Al Nassar Address: 58 Al Kulliah Al Islamyah St. P.O.Box 3176 Amman 11181 Jordan Phone: +962 6 461 3662 Facsimile: +962 6 461 2218

name.narrative: table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } The project is located in the Tilal Al-Rukban area in Muwaqqar district in the Amman governorate, about 30 km north of the Jordanian capital Amman. It will occupy a 600-hectare plot on government-owned land subject to a land-lease agreement. The site is located on the Jordan Highland Plateau at an altitude of approximately 800-840 meters above sea level.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
